title: Engine indications are displayed on EICAS.
caption_en: Engine indications are displayed on EICAS.

title: Engine speed is shown as a percentage of the normal maximum
caption_en: Engine speed is shown as a percentage of the normal maximum

title: Engine temperature, ITT, or Interstage Turbine Temperature i…
caption_en: Engine temperature, ITT, or Interstage Turbine Temperature is also shown on a representative instrument with a moving pointer. The acutal temperature is shown in digital form within the instrument.

title: N2 indication is shown in digital form, also as a percentage…
caption_en: N2 indication is shown in digital form, also as a percentage of the normal maximum

title: Oil Pressure is shown in digital form in PSI.
caption_en: Oil Pressure is shown in digital form in PSI.

title: Oil Temperature is shown in digital form in degrees C.
caption_en: Oil Temperature is shown in digital form in degrees C.

title: Fuel Flow is shown in digital form in kilograms per hour.
caption_en: Fuel Flow is shown in digital form in kilograms per hour.

title: Engine indications are also available on the RMUs. RMU Engin…
caption_en: Engine indications are also available on the RMUs. RMU Engine Page one displays N1 ITT, and oil pressure. The N1 presentation is in the form of a vertial tape with a moving pointer as well as a digital readout.

title: Engine page two displays both N1 and N2 oil temperature and …
caption_en: Engine page two displays both N1 and N2 oil temperature and fuel flow.

title: Digital readouts are normally in white. Some readouts change…
caption_en: Digital readouts are normally in white. Some readouts change to amber or red if the reading reaches abnormal levels.

title: Eicas may also display words in the areas shown shaded. Thes…
caption_en: Eicas may also display words in the areas shown shaded. These displays are referred to as annunciators.

title: Annunciators may be white, green, amber or red. Some amber a…
caption_en: Annunciators may be white, green, amber or red. Some amber annunciators are connected to master caution. Red annunciators are connected to master warning.
